description: System-generated unique identifier for each ledger account row; used as the primary key for joins and auditing.
Structured general ledger account code, typically combining company/cost center and account segments and optional subcodes; used on postings and reports to categorize financial activity.
Human-readable title of the account code shown on financial reports and selections.
Numeric status flag indicating whether the account is active, inactive, or closed; code values are system-defined; confirm with SME.
Code indicating the account’s classification (e.g., asset, liability, revenue, expense) for financial statements and posting rules; numeric mapping varies by implementation; confirm with SME.
Freeform notes about the account’s intended use, such as fuel type, program, or restrictions; not used in posting logic.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this row, regardless of who made the change; used for synchronization and auditing.
Timestamp recorded by the user-facing application for the last change to this row; may mirror the system timestamp; confirm semantics with SME.
Identifier of the user who created the row, for traceability and compliance.
Timestamp when the row was first created.
Identifier of the user who last modified the row.
Timestamp of the most recent user-initiated modification.
